title: England vs South Africa: Frenchman Jerome Garcès to referee Rugby World Cup final
text:
Frenchman Jerome Garcès has been appointed to referee Saturday’s World Cup final between England and South Africa in Yokohama.

With Wayne Barnes - the pre-tournament favourite - ruled out due to England making the final, Nigel Owens was the only other realistic contender.

The Welshman was in charge of the final in 2015 and is generally acknowledged to have had another fine tournament. Most recently, Owens was praised for allowing Saturday’s semi-final between England and New Zealand flow.

However, the 48 year-old will not be involved at all this weekend. Garces - who becomes the first Frenchman to be given the honour - will be joined by his compatriot Romain Poite and New Zealand’s Ben O’Keeffe...
description: Frenchman Jerome Garcès has been appointed to referee Saturday’s World Cup final between England and South Africa in Yokohama.
